website_summaries.verdict: A fantastic alternative to simply providing your rat with a bowl of random seeds and pieces, especially since you know that each rough-edged pellet is composed of premium ingredients, minerals, and vitamins.
pros: Oats, whole barley, and soybean meal are the first 3 ingredients
Contains tasty and nutritious ingredients like yellow peas, carrots, and tomatoes
Tough pellets encourage gnawing and tooth health
cons: This healthy formula can be a little on the pricey side

customer_reviews.title: Approved by Rats
customer_reviews.text: Rats love it, and it's plant based! UPDATE: my rat ended up having an allergic reaction to the food. She was very pink on her skin, extremely itchy to the point of thinning her hair. My rat is now on an antibiotic and I have to bath her with anti-itch shampoo once a week. (Until better). My other rat loved it and had no issues. I'm not 100% sure if the main source of protein was soy, but that is a very common allergy. Still think it's a great food. Just a friendly warning.
customer_reviews.author: Alan Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Supplement this with Oxbow w/ meat and/or fresh fruit/veg and meat
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to supplement my rants non-vegetarian Oxbow food and they love it. They loved it as if I am handing them a treat. I intend to buy more of this when the time comes, simply because they could do with the vegetables. I will not keep this as their main diet however, because I like to feed my rats oysters and beef liver too ie keeping their diet as close to their wild friends, as possible. I am a vegetarian myself, but don’t wish for my beliefs to interfere with their health, values and natural instincts. Rats enjoy a chicken bone to chow, every now and then!
customer_reviews.author: Emily Jayne

customer_reviews.title: Rats didn't like it
customer_reviews.text: Tried converting the rats over to this and they turn their noses up at it. They all prefer the standard food to these blocks. The one rat who ate them had some digestive woes that lasted past the week, so we discontinued feeding altogether. I'll be sticking to the original Oxbow moving forward.
customer_reviews.author: BethTop Contributor: Fountain Pens

customer_reviews.title: My rat doesn't seem to care for it...
customer_reviews.text: My rat, who's about 3 years old now, eats Oxbow standard food pellets/nuggets but I've fed him a mixture of this, the regular oxbow food, and cherries and he doesn't seem to care for the garden selects. It seems like a really good food for raw but mine just doesn't care for it.
customer_reviews.author: kendal

customer_reviews.title: I wish there was more choices!
customer_reviews.text: I wish they would make all their food non-gmo. This particular one gave my boys diarrhea.
customer_reviews.author: Laura D.

customer_reviews.title: Healthy and good for teeth
customer_reviews.text: This block diet is better for your rat's constantly growing teeth. Other, mixed diets are actually unhealthy because rats pick favorite treats and leave the rest, leading to unbalanced meals. This block food is balanced and doesn't allow for unhealthy eating. You should still be giving your rats daily handouts of fresh fruits and veggies in addition to the food, and a few treats.
customer_reviews.author: Sophia Theurer

customer_reviews.title: Crummy mess
customer_reviews.text: oxbow is a great brand but with this one it looks like my rats are operating a saw mill and it's super messy all the time Will be sticking to their regular rat food after this
customer_reviews.author: Josie B.

customer_reviews.title: she immediately got better after having scabs all over her body from eating ...
customer_reviews.text: As soon as we started feeding our female rat this food, she immediately got better after having scabs all over her body from eating crappy food from the pet store. Mostly because it had dried corn it in and that is really bad for rats. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer S.

customer_reviews.title: Stinky Poos
customer_reviews.text: I tried this food after I noticed a dramatic weight loss when I switched off my usual brand onto Oxbow Essentials Adult Rat food. This food made my rats poo turn green and smell a bit off so I tried mixing with Oxbow Essentials Adult Rat food. Unfortunately, my rats passed away before I could see a difference.
customer_reviews.author: Caitlyn Harman

customer_reviews.title: I'll buy this again, it's a good food source.
customer_reviews.text: My rats don't seem to like it but I feed them too much variety. I think my rats like veggies and junk food, aka sunflower seeds and corn. They may eat this is it was their only food. I buy it to be sure they do have a complete 'diet' available.
customer_reviews.author: Heidi Smith

customer_reviews.title: Really Good Rat Food!
customer_reviews.text: My rats love this food. I like that it is in larger chunks so they can nibble on it with their teeth. It gives them something to work for in their insignificant little lives...
customer_reviews.author: Hannah McBeth

customer_reviews.title: My rats love this stuff
customer_reviews.text: My rats love this stuff. It gives them the nutrition they need without all the corn and filler (which are not healthy for rats) which come in standard rat food. I like to give them other food too, so they don't feel like kibble is all they have to eat.
customer_reviews.author: Zoe

customer_reviews.title: Good, recommend mixing with regular food
customer_reviews.text: Good. Some of my rats don't seem to like it as much as the regular stuff but they will still eat it. I mix it in with the regular for. They are bigger pellets which i like
customer_reviews.author: Karey Taylor

customer_reviews.title: The best
customer_reviews.text: A bit expensive, but a great product. I decline to answer the question about 'taste'.
customer_reviews.author: Angelis

customer_reviews.title: Not good.
customer_reviews.text: My rats really hated this, and frankly so did I. Rats were never intended to be vegetarian.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine Holt

customer_reviews.title: best food in the world for my fancy ratty friends
customer_reviews.text: best food in the world for my fancy ratty friends, they love it more then any other food, mixed with the other oxbow rat food, small pellets, thanks you
customer_reviews.author: peggy misencik

customer_reviews.title: Oxbow Rat Food - Superior
customer_reviews.text: I have had Oxbow Rat food before and then it was not stocked in my pet stores in the area. I find the product is superior for the health of my little pets and they have thrived into healthy pets.
customer_reviews.author: Brandy

customer_reviews.title: This rat food is great... I now ONLY get this Garden type for my little rat.
customer_reviews.text: My rat, Andy, loves this food. His fur is nicer since I switched to this garden type of rat food. His skin isn't dry anymore too. He's a happy rat.
customer_reviews.author: Diane Zaczek

customer_reviews.title: Happy and Healthy Rats
customer_reviews.text: My daughter has two fancy rats that have been fed the Oxbow Fortified Nutrition pet food for the past year. They are very healthy and happy and seem to enjoy their meals, so we have stuck with this brand.
customer_reviews.author: WMW

customer_reviews.title: My three girls HATED this stuff
customer_reviews.text: My three girls HATED this stuff. Not sure why. They wouldn't touch it! Maybe the pellets were too big, because if I crushed them up they'd eat a little bit but they never took to it. Went back to the Oxbow Essentials which they love. Odd.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse

customer_reviews.title: Small but compacted
customer_reviews.text: It is so small I thought is was going to be bigger especially because of the price.
customer_reviews.author: Kathiana Torres

customer_reviews.title: My rats love this stuff
customer_reviews.text: My rats love this stuff. I add it to their regular oxbow adult rat food sometimes and they stash it away in their "secret" food hiding spots.
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: Not so much...
customer_reviews.text: My rats eat this food just fine. It smells funny, and their poop volume has increased. The poop also smells more than when they eat standard Oxbow rat food.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Would Order again
customer_reviews.text: Great brand of food. My only complaint is that it shipped super slow.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany Sorrentini

customer_reviews.title: Really good
customer_reviews.text: Rats love this food. Even though it is marked as “Adult Rat Food” I have been using this for my baby’s and it still works great. One thing that worried me was how long it would last. Lasts about a month. Expiration date was a year after I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Gabby

customer_reviews.title: Variety
customer_reviews.text: My rats seem to really like this. Other reviews state that their rats don't. I guess it depends on the rattie. I have not paid attention to their poops smell.
customer_reviews.author: April E Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Rats love it!
customer_reviews.text: My rattie loves this flavor. Oxbow well known by rat owners for quality foods.
customer_reviews.author: nhrn1

customer_reviews.title: A long life for small pets.
customer_reviews.text: This seems to provide an extended life to small rodents. Our mouse lives it and is outliving the anticipated lifespan.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa DeH

customer_reviews.title: Good deal
customer_reviews.text: My full grown rats love this stuff! I have to break the pieces up & make them smaller for my baby rats but they like it too!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Me and the rodents love it!
customer_reviews.text: Best and healthiest choice on the market, my rats loved it and so does my pet squirrel!
customer_reviews.author: Ashlee1228

customer_reviews.title: Oxbow is the way to go for rat food.
customer_reviews.text: I have This food and also the normal oxbow rat food and my rats like both of them. Their fur coat is noticeably shinier since they have eaten owbow.
customer_reviews.author: Noel B

customer_reviews.title: Rats don’t like veggies.
customer_reviews.text: My young rats did not rave over this product. I doubt it’s because of their age. Great for baby rabbits, though.
customer_reviews.author: Genevieve Parry

customer_reviews.title: The right food would be appreciated.
customer_reviews.text: I needed rat food and was sent hamster food. They do not give me an option to replace or give refund.
customer_reviews.author: stevenson stevens

customer_reviews.title: Rats Love It
customer_reviews.text: My two girls have eaten this food their whole lives. They love it and are very healthy 1yo fur balls.
customer_reviews.author: Luke Potter

customer_reviews.title: I like it
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be liked by the girls and not as much waste
customer_reviews.author: Kimby

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: The rats love it, gives them something to chew on since it's hard. I like the fact that I have an option to give them something relatively natural rather than something not.
customer_reviews.author: Daina T.

customer_reviews.title: This is a well balanced food.
customer_reviews.text: The price seems a little much for the amount compared to their other foods but its overall a good product. The pieces are a fair size and they seem to like it.
customer_reviews.author: Audrey

customer_reviews.title: They seem to really like it!
customer_reviews.text: We use this variety as "treats" for our pet rats. They seem to really like it!
customer_reviews.author: No Public Name

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I like to add this to their basic oxbow adult rat food. They love it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My Rats hate it
customer_reviews.text: I'm sure the product is great, my rats have eaten regular Oxbow diet their whole life they will take these pellets and move them to the side of their cage and never eat them they do not like them at all !
customer_reviews.author: Natalie

customer_reviews.title: My Rat Likes It
customer_reviews.text: My rat seems to like this food (Albeit he is a wild Roof Rat).
customer_reviews.author: Victoria W

product_meta.title: Oxbow Animal Health Garden Select Adult Rat Food, Garden-Inspired Recipe for Adult Rats, Non-GMO, Made in The USA, 2.5 Pound Bag
product_meta.description: **NOW AVAILABLE! ! ! ** Complete, balanced, and bursting with garden fresh flavor. Garden Select Adult Rat contains all of the complete nutrition you’ve come to expect from Oxbow, with a flavor profile hand-picked from Mother Nature’s kitchen. Select garden ingredients such as whole yellow pea, tomato, carrot, spinach, and banana give this adult rat food its delectable, garden fresh flavor. All Garden Select varieties are Project Non-GMO certified. Size: 2. 5 lbs Ingredients Oat Groats, Whole Barley, Soybean Meal, Cane Molasses, Oat Grass, Orchard Grass, White Rice, Whole Yellow Pea, Soybean Oil, Sodium Bentonite, Calcium Carbonate, Flaxseed, Monocalcium Phosphate, Lignin Sulfonate, DL–Methionine, Salt, Magnesium Oxide, Spinach Powder, Tomato Powder, Choline Chloride, Banana Powder, Carrot Powder, Hydrolyzed Yeast, Yucca Schidigera Extract, Mixed Tocopherols (preservative), Vitamin E Supplement, Zinc Oxide, Manga nous Oxide, Mineral Oil, L-Ascorbyl-2-Monophosphate (Vitamin C), Niacin, Copper Sulfate, Zinc Proteinate, Biotin, d-Calcium Pantothenate, Copper Proteinate, Manganese Proteinate, Riboflavin Supplement, Vitamin A Supplement, Pyridoxine Hydrochloride, Sodium Selenite, Thiamine Mononitrate, Vitamin D3 Supplement, Folic Acid, Menadione Sodium Bisulfite Complex (Vitamin K) , Vitamin B12 Supplement, Calcium Iodate, Cobalt Carbonate, Rosemary Extract Analysis Crude Protein (min) 16. 00% Crude Fat (min) 4. 00% Crude Fiber (min) 2. 00% Crude Fiber (max) 5. 00% Moisture (max) 12. 00% Calcium (min) 1. 00% Calcium (max) 1. 50% Phosphorus (min) 0. 80% Vitamin A (min) 8, 000 IU/kg Vitamin D (min) 1, 000 IU/kg Vitamin E (min) 125 IU/kg
feature_bullets: Contains unique, high-quality garden ingredients that mimic those found in your pet’s natural foraging environment
Uniform block features rugged edges for gnawing

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
